channel.title: My RS2D project -- scar317
channel.description:
Okay, this is my first development that I am going to dedicate my time to >_>[hr] The server name is Scar317. The first four letters "Scar" are from my original server ScarNastics. 317 Represents the base. [hr]About Scar317, Scar317 is currently created by me Sonis RuZuix; On which the names I usually use are as follows: Sonis, test, me, and Scar Scar317 probably won't be like any other server on an actual scale; I am using the wL as a map for ideas (i.e. What are actual good ideas -- X/Y Chords -- EmoteList -- GFX -- sendQuest locations -- etc...) As of right now, My plan is to support OpenSource, but I do not want to release any half-ass'd project. I will release some elements of the project -- DB and raw data information for example. [hr] This is what I have done so far to a raw/fresh copy of RS2D(v)...
[ul][li]Renamed net.varek.rs2d to tv.sonis.scar317[/li] [li]Added a update.xml (and xsl.xsl for xslt) to keep track of update loggs... If you like a RSS-FEED of the update loggs, please go here: http://sonis.tv/RSS/Updates.xml[/li] [li]I Made a class for Items. example of my class here: http://sonis.tv/RSS/Item.java.txt I also made another class called Default that inheirts that class. I'm not releasing that as of right now, because It has my sql password, but I can release this awesome db of items that has 20k items with 83 fields each. As of right now, I havn't combined the notes.dat,twohanded.dat,tradable.dat,sellable.dat,stackable.dat to the sql db file yet. That's not going to be too hard. The sql db is 50mb of raw data as xml and 6mb as sql.txt download the http://sonis.tv/RSS/ItemDB.sql.txt -- Last example I'm releasing...[/li] [li]I'll Also Make Pictures for you wierdo's...[/li] [li][/li] [li][/li] [li]And I usually use MySQL GUI Tools 5.0 to edit my MySQL[/li][/ul]
[img]http://sonis.tv/RSS/screen00001.PNG[/img] [hr] My plan is mostly to look for a free mysql host with unlimited traffic then I won't feel bad giving my sql password out. I know that Oracle is much better, but they aren't open source, and keeping projects legit will be my best bet.
As of right now, I can spawn Items by command, but I can only have them in the first invotory space... They can't be moved and I can only equip Items that are weapons as of right now... I can unequip ... I know that I misspelled inventory... But in my class; it's invotory. I Might fix it later. It's not really a big deal >_> keep it ironic twist ? I think I uploaded it too, but oh well...
I'd appreciate a review how I have my Item class set up. I have Equipment and Invotory inheirting from Item with a private field. It took me a while; but I found out that the only way to call is from the World.getWorld to get the player class, else the player class will initiate as a new object; and this will not edit the server... All classes have different settings for each thread. And most of the new processes are new threads.... I was going to use HashTable because It auto-sync; but I prefer lock-and-unlock method from the HashMap. I think the HashMap was designed really well to link to each other in unison.
last thing: I know as of right now; The source isn't java conversion compliant .... Will auto fix that when I actually release. I just started using a IDE today, I was compiling the server like Finality was being compiled, the non-ant way =|
Oh; and the reason I set up the Item class that way was for a reason that You can improve a certain item's stats with higher smiting levels similar to some of the games out there. Also so you can have more than 1 pile of gold for an example. If you max out a money pile, you'll auto fill the next available slot is my plan. I also have it so that certain Items keep track of pk scores (which can get stat level ups if you get enough)... And you can have more than 1 track record, and can also sell them... That's just my idea, and if the hash is different, it's a different item. I also was thinking of it so that you can enter ::this_item 01 equipSlot 00 and The given Item will then be a hat. So you can wear 2 body plates >_>... or ::this_item 01 equipSlot 10 will make the first Item in invotory now boots according to Item.FEET;
I'll take the junk out later and I'll fix grammar mistakes and spelling mistakes out of my thread on a later date of time.

item.title: My RS2D project -- scar317
item.dc:creator: @bhpkyeah satesql
item.description:
@bhpkyeah wrote:

Nice job, seems like you actually know what your talking about.

Read full topic

This looks great. Never got into RS2D, now I wish I had.

item.title: My RS2D project -- scar317
item.dc:creator: @Sonis Sonis
item.description:
@Sonis wrote:

Okay, this is my first development that I am going to dedicate my time to >_>[hr]
The server name is Scar317.
The first four letters “Scar” are from my original server ScarNastics. 317 Represents the base.
[hr]About Scar317,
Scar317 is currently created by me Sonis RuZuix; On which the names I usually use are as follows:
Sonis, test, me, and Scar
Scar317 probably won’t be like any other server on an actual scale; I am using the wL as a map for ideas
(i.e. What are actual good ideas – X/Y Chords – EmoteList – GFX – sendQuest locations – etc…)
As of right now, My plan is to support OpenSource, but I do not want to release any half-ass’d project.
I will release some elements of the project – DB and raw data information for example.
[hr]
This is what I have done so far to a raw/fresh copy of RS2D(v)…

[ul][li]Renamed net.varek.rs2d to tv.sonis.scar317[/li]
[li]Added a update.xml (and xsl.xsl for xslt) to keep track of update loggs…
If you like a RSS-FEED of the update loggs, please go here: http://sonis.tv/RSS/Updates.xml[/li]
[li]I Made a class for Items. example of my class here: http://sonis.tv/RSS/Item.java.txt
I also made another class called Default that inheirts that class. I’m not releasing that as of right now, because It has my sql password, but I can release this awesome db of items that has 20k items with 83 fields each. As of right now, I havn’t combined the notes.dat,twohanded.dat,tradable.dat,sellable.dat,stackable.dat to the sql db file yet. That’s not going to be too hard. The sql db is 50mb of raw data as xml and 6mb as sql.txt download the http://sonis.tv/RSS/ItemDB.sql.txt – Last example I’m releasing…[/li]
[li]I’ll Also Make Pictures for you wierdo’s…[/li]
[li][/li]
[li][/li]
[li]And I usually use MySQL GUI Tools 5.0 to edit my MySQL[/li][/ul]


[hr]
My plan is mostly to look for a free mysql host with unlimited traffic then I won’t feel bad giving my sql password out.
I know that Oracle is much better, but they aren’t open source, and keeping projects legit will be my best bet.

As of right now, I can spawn Items by command, but I can only have them in the first invotory space… They can’t be moved and I can only equip Items that are weapons as of right now… I can unequip … I know that I misspelled inventory… But in my class; it’s invotory. I Might fix it later. It’s not really a big deal >_> keep it ironic twist ? I think I uploaded it too, but oh well…

I’d appreciate a review how I have my Item class set up. I have Equipment and Invotory inheirting from Item with a private field. It took me a while; but I found out that the only way to call is from the World.getWorld to get the player class, else the player class will initiate as a new object; and this will not edit the server… All classes have different settings for each thread. And most of the new processes are new threads… I was going to use HashTable because It auto-sync; but I prefer lock-and-unlock method from the HashMap. I think the HashMap was designed really well to link to each other in unison.

last thing: I know as of right now; The source isn’t java conversion compliant … Will auto fix that when I actually release. I just started using a IDE today, I was compiling the server like Finality was being compiled, the non-ant way =|

Oh; and the reason I set up the Item class that way was for a reason that You can improve a certain item’s stats with higher smiting levels similar to some of the games out there. Also so you can have more than 1 pile of gold for an example. If you max out a money pile, you’ll auto fill the next available slot is my plan. I also have it so that certain Items keep track of pk scores (which can get stat level ups if you get enough)… And you can have more than 1 track record, and can also sell them… That’s just my idea, and if the hash is different, it’s a different item. I also was thinking of it so that you can enter ::this_item 01 equipSlot 00 and The given Item will then be a hat. So you can wear 2 body plates >_>… or ::this_item 01 equipSlot 10 will make the first Item in invotory now boots according to Item.FEET;

I’ll take the junk out later and I’ll fix grammar mistakes and spelling mistakes out of my thread on a later date of time.
